alert.note: Alert for Ziebach (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 11:30PM MDT until June 23 at 5:30AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Ziebach County in west central South Dakota... * Until 530 AM MDT. * At 1130 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, and roads as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dupree, Red Elm and western Cheyenne River Reservation. This includes the following streams and drainages... Elm Creek, South Fork Flat Rock Creek, Knife Creek, Moreau River, Rattlesnake Creek, Flint Rock Creek, Red Coat Creek, Cottonwood Creek and Butcher Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
